intro: Borreria macrantha, commonly known as redroot false flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Borreria macrantha is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
